Subsection.Text: Where the course or courses to be taught are prescribed by the board or approved precedent to registration, licensure, certification, or renewal as a registered trainee appraiser, licensed appraiser, or certified residential appraiser, before commencing to instruct noncredit college courses in a college, university, or community college, or courses in a career center or proprietary real estate school, a person must certify her or his competency by meeting one of the following requirements:

Paragraph.Text: Hold a valid certification as a residential real estate appraiser in this or any other state.
Pass an appraiser instructor’s examination which shall test knowledge of residential appraisal topics.

Subsection.Text: Where the course or courses to be taught are prescribed by the board or approved precedent to registration, licensure, certification, or renewal as a registered trainee appraiser, licensed appraiser, or certified appraiser, before commencing to instruct noncredit college courses in a college, university, or community college, or courses in a career center or proprietary real estate school, a person must certify her or his competency by meeting one of the following requirements:

Paragraph.Text: Hold a valid certification as a general real estate appraiser in this or any other state.
Pass an appraiser instructor’s examination which shall test knowledge of residential and nonresidential appraisal topics.

Subsection.Text: Possession of a permit to teach prescribed or approved appraisal courses does not entitle the permitholder to teach any courses outside the scope of the permit.
